meanings.definition: To make something subject to government control or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The new law will governmentalize the healthcare system, ensuring it follows strict regulations.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted to governmentalize the public transportation system, allowing for better oversight.
meanings.sent3: I never thought I would see the day when they would governmentalize the internet, but here we are!
meanings.sent4: Her proposal to governmentalize the school lunch program was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent5: The decision to governmentalize the energy sector was a bold move by the administration.

meanings.definition: To bring something under the authority of a government.
meanings.sent1: The new policy will governmentalize the previously independent agency, bringing it under government control.
meanings.sent2: The treaty signed by both countries will governmentalize the disputed territory, resolving the conflict.
meanings.sent3: It's like they want to governmentalize everything, even our backyard barbecues!
meanings.sent4: The move to governmentalize the private sector was seen as a drastic step by many.
meanings.sent5: The decision to governmentalize the national parks was met with both praise and criticism.
